issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
YARN-3591 added the {{checkLocalResource}} method to {{isResourcePresent()}} call to allow checking an already localized resource against the list of good/full directories.

Since LocalResourcesTrackerImpl instantiations for app level resources and private resources do not use the new constructor, such resources that are on bad disk will never be checked against good dirs.
fields.summary: Non-public resource localization on a bad disk causes subsequent containers failure

comments.body: v1 patch that calls the constructor for LocalResourceTracker with LocalDirsHandlerService object. It dies that also in the case where it is trying to recover resources.

This message was automatically generated.
Minor checkstyle issues. Will fix in upcoming patches. Request for review on the approach and any concerns with this change. [~jlowe]/ [~nroberts].

Thanks for the patch!  Patch looks good overall.

At this point the only callers of the LocalResourcesTrackerImpl constructor that omits the directory handler are tests, and I think it would be better to simply remove this constructor and update the few places in the tests to explicitly pass null.  That way future maintainers won't be lulled into thinking it's OK to call the constructor without a handler, since it clearly needs a dir handler to properly deal with resources that get orphaned on bad disks.
Thanks [~jlowe] for the quick response. I have updated the patch.

Thanks [~jlowe], let me know if a 2.8 patch is required as well.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #11788 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/11788/])
